dialogues.text: MURRAY BABITCH drives, his head against the glass. The radio dribbles sports scores. THE BRIDGE APPROACH GLOWS blue-green under the mercury li tangle of pot-holed ramps and deserted vehicles. Babitch slows, moving through a red light.

THE OTHER KID sits, his forehead sprinkled across the das COTTER (THE RED-HAIRED COP) TAKES SOMETHING FROM THE CAR. AN HISPANIC MEDIC nudges him out of the way.

dialogues.text: Traffic incident. Bullshit, man. The medic glances at the rear window of the Mazda. It is shattered five times, from five small holes.

Off in the darkness, FREDDY sits at the river's edge. Tears run down his cheeks. He faces the water and the lig the great city beyond. The water moves slowly, hypnotical A CAT WITH A BELL AROUND ITS NECK rubs against Freddy's l Freddy pets the cat, his eyes moving again to - THE CITY ACROSS THE RIVER. A SIREN SOUNDS and one can see lights of emergency vehicles on the George Washington Bri Suddenly; SPIRALING RED LIGHTS MOVE ACROSS THE BACK OF FR HEAD, THE SIDE OF HIS FACE. THE SIREN IS HERE. Freddy turns, wiping his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: I am a cop.

dialogues.speaker: TILDEN
dialogues.text: - pined to be N-Y-P-D: Three force ‘apps in ten years. Appeals of hearing tests. You may be law enforcement. So am 1. But you are not a "cop." Across the street - OUTSIDE THE FOUR ACES - RAY GLYNN, CO RANDONE, LAGONDA AND OTHERS converse in a huddle.

dialogues.speaker: TILDEN
dialogues.text: Now, I may watch cops. But - tell me if I'm wrong - so do you. And because we are both law enforcement. we share a duty. Where there's a stink, we must investigate. We must gather evidence. Because evidence makes us see the truth. Is this the stink of a criminal act? Or is it a turd ina bag? No - listen to me, Sheriff. Everyday, I see cops who lost their way. And I can tell you - these lost cops - they are the Minority - but they tend to gather. They can be family men. Heroes. They can have their reasons. But they are also the cops who bring cases down. Addicted cops. Cops who look the other way. Cops who plant. Cops who beat. Cops who take. Cops who kill. Their ambivalence is contagious. They infect those around them. They are like maggots. Where you find one - you often find a nest. Now, I don't like this. I went to the same fucking Academy. I stood by Ray Glynn at graduation. He was a beauty. A piece of work. And to the cop he was - to his memory - I am loyal. But through the fog of my loyalty - to the men - the evidence makes me see. And these days - what I see - like an island - out of my reach - I see a beautiful island - shining through this fog - every house financed by one of two mob banks - uh-huh, that's right, Sheriff - what I see is your town. Freddy shakes his head. Tilden takes a deep drag. OUTSIDE - GLYNN AND COMPANY disperse, some climbing into and driving off. Glynn and Cotter head into the Four Aces

Lifeless, she lies in the reeds. He presses his mouth against hers. He blows (so gently, the air squirts out the sides.) No response. He blows again. Determined. And again. Her belly swells.
